intro: Randia dasycarpa, commonly known as the rough-fruited randia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a small, round drupe with a rough, hairy surface. Randia dasycarpa is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
